intro: Tetracera nordtiana var. louisiadica, commonly known as the Lourie's tetracera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is often found in humid, lowland forest environments. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
